info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 9:26PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Light snow through Midnight... An area of light snow will affect the southern Rocky Mountain Front, Lincoln, Helena, Boulder and White Sulphur Springs area through Midnight. Visibility will be a few miles, as roadways become snow covered and slippery. New snow accumulations around one half inch are possible at lower elevations, and around 1 inch in the mountains. Those traveling on Interstate 15 from Craig to Boulder, or Highway 12 from MacDonald Pass to White Sulphur Springs should be alert for areas of poor visibility because of falling snow. Also, with temperatures below freezing, any wet roadways will gradually become icy overnight.
